title: Magazine Design—All Exlibris fonts
content:
I finally got around to updating—read: replacing—my web site. Up goes the new content, including this hand-made typography magazine (recycling images and text from other magazines, it was a school project) designed entirely in fonts by Jos Buivenga.  
 [http://www.jpad.biz/index.php?/whateley-magazine/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231003943/http:/www.jpad.biz/index.php?/whateley-magazine/ "http://www.jpad.biz/index.php?/whateley-magazine/")
author: blank

comments.content:
I love the magazine. Your new site is great. Very attractive and does a good job of showcasing your work.

Sharon

Really nice work James.

The one thing I wish more designers would do is mention the typefaces they use in the projects they are showing.

I used to list more details about type, software, etc. with all my projects. But more than one person told me that it made my portfolio look like the work of an amateur more concerned with the parts than with the design.

Very, very nice James. I'm truly impressed and equally thrilled. Great job!  
And thank you for mentioning me (and my foundry).

Hmm. Amateur. How rude.

Well you could always include a colophon.
